channel.title: [SOLVED]Registering account - MYSQL + PHP[SOLVED]
channel.description: anyone here know how to do this? I've got a .php script that seems to register the account, but it will not let me log in for some odd reason. It just keeps saying Invalid Username/Pass when i try logging in. I'm using DQ source btw

item.title: [SOLVED]Registering account - MYSQL + PHP[SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

Fear Nuture:

the web register page i have does create the character in the sql, with SHA1 encrypted password.

Did you try using MD5 instead of SHA1, the first time a set up a forums with character creation i had that same problem. Also be sure your login server is running fine when you try to log in.

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED]Registering account - MYSQL + PHP[SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @Fear_Nuture Fear Nuture
item.description:
@Fear_Nuture wrote:

[quote=“sw0o0sh, post:4, topic:434477”]Diagnose your problem in three easy steps:

A) CHECK SQL VIA PHPMYADMIN TO SEE IF CHARACTER HAS BEEN MADE IN _players TABLE
B) MAKE SURE THAT THE WEBPAGE IS SHA1() YOUR PSWDS CUZ PEETER SHA1’S ALL DAY
C) MAKE SURE THAT THE SERVER SRC IS SHA1() PSWDS CUZ PEETER SHA1’s ALL DAY[/quote]

the web register page i have does create the character in the sql, with SHA1 encrypted password.
the web page i use to register encrypts the password is SHA1 to sql.
not sure about the source, but it’s peeter’s source, and i hear he SHA1 all day, so i assume its SHA1 too.

if you can help ive got tv and msn

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED]Registering account - MYSQL + PHP[SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @sw0o0sh sw0o0sh
item.description:
@sw0o0sh wrote:

Diagnose your problem in three easy steps:

A) CHECK SQL VIA PHPMYADMIN TO SEE IF CHARACTER HAS BEEN MADE IN _players TABLE
B) MAKE SURE THAT THE WEBPAGE IS SHA1() YOUR PSWDS CUZ PEETER SHA1’S ALL DAY
C) MAKE SURE THAT THE SERVER SRC IS SHA1() PSWDS CUZ PEETER SHA1’s ALL DAY

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED]Registering account - MYSQL + PHP[SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @Fear_Nuture Fear Nuture
item.description:
@Fear_Nuture wrote:

why would WWW files prevent account creation? I’ve got a account creation php script, it works, it registers the right username and password, but it won’t let me login with the username and password it registered. I can’t figure it out.

Read full topic
